required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to collect and evaluate pregnancy outcomes, pregnancy complications, and fetal/neonatal/infant outcomes in women exposed to patisiran-LNP.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From 12 weeks prior to last dose of patisiran through one year after birth (Up to 21 months)
primary_outcome.description: Major congenital malformations will be classified according to the European Concerted Action on Congenital Anomalies and Twins (EUROCAT) and Metropolitan Atlanta Congenital Defects Program (MACDP) classification systems.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 12 weeks prior to last dose of patisiran through one year after birth (Up to 21 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Minor congenital malformations will be classified classified according to the EUROCAT and MACDP classification systems.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 12 weeks prior to last dose of patisiran through one year after birth (Up to 21 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Pregnancy outcomes are defined as live birth, spontaneous abortions, stillbirths, elective abortions, molar or pregnancy, ectopic pregnancy, preterm births, and maternal death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of Other Adverse Fetal/Neonatal/Infant Outcomes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 12 weeks prior to last dose of patisiran through one year after birth (Up to 21 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Other adverse fetal/neonatal/infant outcomes are defined as low birth weight, failure to thrive, small for gestational age, postnatal growth and development, neonatal, and perinatal, or infant death.

arm_group.description: Pregnant women exposed to commercial patisiran-LNP (ONPATTRO) during the 12 weeks prior to their last menstrual period (LMP) or at any time during pregnancy.

study_pop.textblock: Any woman exposed to patisiran-LNP 12 weeks prior to their last menstrual period (LMP) or at any time during pregnancy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Documentation that the patient was exposed to patisiran-LNP at any point starting from 12 weeks before LMP or at any point during pregnancy
Exclusion Criteria:
- There are no exclusion criteria for participation in this program.
